results.title: Le Petit Soldat
results.brief_description:
The peaceful life of the residents of a toy shop is disturbed by a goverment order declaring war on all toys and ordering their destruction. A mechanical acrobat, in love with a wax doll, must become a toy soldier in order to restore peace in the shop. While he is away, the wax doll falls prey to a nasty toy bird.

Credits: Producer, Andre Sarut ; director, Paul Grimault ; writers, Paul Grimault, Jacques Prevert ; music, Joseph Kosma.

results.title: Jules Verne
results.brief_description:
Jules Verne had three passions in life: the sea, music and freedom. The passion for the sea started during his childhood in Nantes, in the Quartier de l’Ile Feydeau, filled with memeories of explorers and slave traders. Destined to become a lawyer, Verne is sent to Paris where he begins to write. His writings are highly influenced by the industrial revolution and the belief in the power of the machine to transform the world.

Credits: Director, Jean Vidal ; writer, Yolande Cassin.
Cast: Daniel Ivernel [narration only].

results.title: Le Paris de Robert Doisneau
results.brief_description:
Robert Doisneau’s unique vision of Paris is presented through a montage of his most famous photographs. There is no commentary, only music and sound effects.

Credits: Producer, Marie Corajoud ; director, Francois Porcile ; photography, Pierre Dupouey ; music, Pierre Gamet.

results.title: Georges Melies
results.brief_description:
A survey of the life and work of film pioneer Georges Melies covering his work as a graphic artist, magician, theatre entrepreneur, filmmaker and actor. Illustrated by graphics, stills, and one clip from his films.

Credits: Director, Claude Leroy.

results.title: Le Jongleur de Notre-Dame = the Juggler of Notre-Dame
results.brief_description:
Barnabe is a juggler who performs on fairs and markets with much success. When war starts, Barnabe is given shelter in a monastry. He proves to be of no use around the monks as he has no other skills but juggling.

Credits: Director, Lonati Bettiol ; writer, Maurice Genevoix ; photograhy, Bob Zoubovitch ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Jean Rochefort [narration only].

results.title: Georges Mathieu
results.brief_description:
A profile of artist Georges Mathieu detailing the production of a series of advertising posters for Air France.

Credits: Director, Pierre Lhoste.

results.title: Picasso Peintre du Siecle = Picasso Artist of the Century
results.brief_description:
Profile of one of the most influential artist of the 20th century. Highlights includes the genesis of the famous painting ‘Guernica’.

Credits: Producer, Simon Schiffrin ; director, Lauro Venturi ; writer, Jean Leymarie ; photography, Jean Bourgoin ; music, Roman Vlad.
Cast: Alain Mottet [narration only].
